text: Someone from the HubSpot team who can shine his light on this?

In this case the page is dynamic, you will code the entire page content and select in the settings the data source being the hubDB table.
So your editors won't be editing the pages any more, they will fill out a HubDB table, each new row will generate a dynamic page.
This way you can also code a menu module that can get all the pages listed in the HubDB table.

Wondering if someone here could clear something up for me.  I’m looking to implement CAPTCHA across forms on my site, but when I test it, I don’t get presented with a puzzle when I submit.  Does this only happen for “suspicious” users, or is there something I’m missing?

You are right. only for suspicious visitors:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/prevent-spam-form-submissions#:~:text=If%20Google%20determines%20that%20a%20visitor%20is%20suspicious,%20they%20must%20solve%20a%20CAPTCHA%20challenge%20before%20they%20can%20submit%20the%20form|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/prevent-spam-form-submissions#:~:text=If%20Google%20determines%20that[…]efore%20they%20can%20submit%20the%20form>

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
